\Okta\Resource

\Okta\ResourceAuthentication

Implementation of the Okta Authentication resource, access via $okta->auth

http://developer.okta.com/docs/api/resources/authn.html

authn()

authn(string  $username, string  $password, string  $relayState = null, array  $options = null, array  $context = null) : object

Every authentication transaction starts with primary authentication which validates a user's primary password credential. Password Policy, MFA Policy, and Sign-On Policy is evaluated during primary authentication to determine if the user's password is expired, a factor should be enrolled, or additional verification is required.

Parameters

string $username

User's non-qualified short-name or unique fully-qualified login
string $password

User's password credential
string $relayState

Optional state value that is persisted for the lifetime of the authentication transaction
array $options

Array of opt-in features for the authentication transaction
array $context

Array of additional context properties for the authentication transaction

Returns

object —

Authentication Transaction Object

Tags

None found

changePassword()

changePassword(string  $stateToken, string  $oldPassword, string  $newPassword) : object

This operation changes a user's password by providing the existing password and the new password password for authentication transactions with either the PASSWORD_EXPIRED or PASSWORD_WARN state.

  • A user must change their expired password for an authentication transaction with PASSWORD_EXPIRED status to successfully complete the transaction.

    • A user may opt-out of changing their password (skip) when the transaction has a PASSWORD_WARN status

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for current transaction
string $oldPassword

User's current password that is expired or about to expire
string $newPassword

New password for user

Returns

object —

Authentication Transaction Object

Tags

None found

enrollFactor()

enrollFactor(string  $stateToken, string  $factorType, string  $provider, array  $profile) : object

Enrolls a user with a factor assigned by their MFA Policy.

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for current transaction
string $factorType

Type of factor
string $provider

Factor provider
array $profile

Associative array containing profile key/values of a supported factor

Returns

object —

forgotPassword()

forgotPassword(string  $username, string  $factorType = null, string  $relayState = null) : object

Starts a new password recovery transaction for a given user and issues a recovery token that can be used to reset a user's password.

Parameters

string $username

User's non-qualified short-name or unique fully-qualified login
string $factorType

Recovery factor to use for primary authentication (EMAIL or SMS)
string $relayState

Optional state value that is persisted for the lifetime of the recovery transaction

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

Tags

None found

unlockAccount()

unlockAccount(string  $username, string  $factorType = null, string  $relayState = null) : object

Starts a new unlock recovery transaction for a given user and issues a recovery token that can be used to unlock a user's account.

Parameters

string $username

User's non-qualified short-name or unique fully-qualified login
string $factorType

Recovery factor to use for primary authentication (EMAIL or SMS)
string $relayState

Optional state value that is persisted for the lifetime of the recovery transaction

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

Tags

None found

verifySmsRecoveryFactor()

verifySmsRecoveryFactor(string  $stateToken, string  $passCode) : object

Verifies a SMS OTP (passCode) sent to the user's mobile phone for primary authentication for a recovery transaction with RECOVERY_CHALLENGE status.

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for current recovery transaction
string $passCode

OTP sent to device

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

verifyRecoveryToken()

verifyRecoveryToken(string  $recoveryToken) : object

Validates a recovery token that was distributed to the end-user to continue the recovery transaction.

string $recoveryToken

Recovery token that was distributed to end-user via out-of-band mechanism such as email

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

Tags

answerRecoveryQuestion()

answerRecoveryQuestion(string  $stateToken, string  $answer) : object

Answers the user's recovery question to ensure only the end-user redeemed the recovery token for recovery transaction with a RECOVERY status.

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for current transaction
string $answer

Answer to user's recovery question

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

resetPassword()

resetPassword(string  $stateToken, string  $newPassword) : object

Resets a user's password to complete a recovery transaction with a PASSWORD_RESET state.

State token for current transaction
string $newPassword

User's new password

Tags

None found

skipState()

skipState(string  $stateToken) : object

Moves the current transaction state back to the previous state. This operation is only available for MFA_ENROLL or PASSWORD_WARN states when published as a link

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for a transaction

Returns

object —

Recovery Transaction Object

Tags

None found

cancel()

cancel(string  $stateToken) : object

Cancels the current transaction and revokes the state token.

Parameters

string $stateToken

State token for a transaction

Returns

object —

Empty object or object containing optional state value that was persisted for the authentication or recovery transaction

Tags

None found
